Protocols/SceneGeneratorDelegate.html#/s.name: updateScene()
Protocols/SceneGeneratorDelegate.html#/s.abstract: This function updates the singleton scene object that is viewed in the app.

Protocols/SceneGeneratorDelegate.html.name: SceneGeneratorDelegate
Protocols/SceneGeneratorDelegate.html.abstract: This is a custom protocol whose sole purpose is to update the scene whenever the user adjusts the inputs in the app.

Extensions/SCNVector3.html.name: SCNVector3
Extensions/SCNVector3.html.abstract: This enables the WallModel’s position to be encoded and decoded, as it is a necessary piece of information when re-constructing a saved box template.

Enums/WallType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Wa.name: smallCorner
Enums/WallType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Wa.abstract: case smallCorner: parallel to the x-y plane

Enums/WallType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Wa.name: longCorner
Enums/WallType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Wa.abstract: case longCorner: parallel to the y-z plane

Enums/WallType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Wa.name: topSide
Enums/WallType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Wa.abstract: The topSide WallType is parallel to the X-Z plane. It must be differentiated from the bottom to correctly draw and render slot joins. For overlap joins, this wall overlaps both longCorner and smallCorner wall types. This type used to be defined by “largeCorner,” but was refactored by FS Fall 2020.

Enums/WallType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Wa.name: bottomSide
Enums/WallType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Wa.abstract: The bottomSide WallType is parallel to the X-Z plane. It must be differentiated from the top to correctly draw and render slot joins. For overlap joins, this wall overlaps both longCorner and smallCorner wall types. This type used to be defined by “largeCorner,” but was refactored by FS Fall 2020.

Enums/ShapeType.html#/s:12Box_Designer9S.name: roundedRectangle
Enums/ShapeType.html#/s:12Box_Designer9S.abstract: This is the rounded rectangle cutout shape.

Enums/JoinType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Jo.name: tab
Enums/JoinType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Jo.abstract: The tab join is interlocking; for now, the application allows for the number of tabs to be changed by the user. The construction of this type of join is dependent on material thickness, as the box shouldn’t have overhanging sides.

Enums/JoinType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Jo.name: overlap
Enums/JoinType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Jo.abstract: The overlap join requires some type of adhesive after being laser-cut in order to construct the box. The construction of this type of join is dependent on the material thickness, as the box shouldn’t have overhanging sides.

Enums/JoinType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Jo.name: slot
Enums/JoinType.html#/s:12Box_Designer8Jo.abstract: The slot join does not require adhesive to be put together. It essentially has half slits on each wall, creating an interlocking structure.

Enums/JoinType.html.name: JoinType
Enums/JoinType.html.abstract: This is the enumerated type for the way the box walls are joined together. Associated strings are for JoinType to conform to Codable.

Enums/ShapeType.html.name: ShapeType
Enums/ShapeType.html.abstract: This class provides the possible cutouts as an enum. It is necessary for WallModel.wallShapes’ [Shape] to conform to the Decodable protocol. It can also be easily extended to add more cutout shapes.

Enums/WallType.html.name: WallType
Enums/WallType.html.abstract: These enum cases correspond to the three types of wall construction commonly used when designing

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: boxModel
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This variable instantiates a new box model that will be updated by the user. It is instantiated with the default values found in BoxModel init().

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: unitConversionFactor
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This variable is the conversion factor from inches to millimeters, used for unit conversion.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: minTabs
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This variable determines the minimum number of tabs that can be made, as the path generation can only handle more than this number of tabs due to how path generation works.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: previousTabEntry
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: Records the previous amount of tabs entered by the user.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: selectionHandling
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This variable is the selection handling singleton.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: fileHandlingControl
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This variable is the file handling control singleton.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: boxView
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable is the view object that’s displayed in the app.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: pdfOptionsView
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable is the accessory view object displayed in the save panel.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: mmMenu
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable is the millimeter option in the Taskbar -> Format -> Units.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: inchMenu
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable is the inches option in the Taskbar -> Format -> Units.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: lengthTextField
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable is the textbox for box length that users can change in the main GUI.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: widthTextField
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable is the textbox for box width that users can change in the main GUI.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: heightTextField
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable is the textbox for box height that users can change in the main GUI.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: materialThicknessTextField
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable is the textbox for box material thickness that users can change in the main GUI.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: innerOrOuterDimensionControl
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable allows selection for the displayed dimensions to include (or not include) the walls themselves.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: joinTypeControl
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable allows for selection of user’s desired join type (tab, overlap, slotted).

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: unitChoiceControl
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable allows for selection of dimension units (inches or millimeters).

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: numberTabTextField
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable is the textbox for number of tabs (if “Tab” join type is selected) that users can change in main GUI.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: lengthLabel
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is the label for the box length textbox. It must be a variable for the units to be displayed (and the units can change).

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: widthLabel
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is the label for the box width textbox. It must be a variable for the units to be displayed (and the units can change).

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: heightLabel
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is the label for the box height textbox. It must be a variable for the units to be displayed (and the units can change).

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: thicknessLabel
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This is the label for the box material thickness textbox. It must be a variable for the units to be displayed (and the units can change).

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: exportButton
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable allows users to export their box template directly from the main GUI (they can also do this from the taskbar).

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: addWallType
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable indicates whether the added component should be an external wall or internal separator.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: selectedWallPlane
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable outputs the plane that the selected wall is on and its placement.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: addWallPlane
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable indicates the plane that the added wall component should align with. It changes when you select a wall, to indicate the plane the wall is oriented on.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: addPlacement
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable indicates the placement of the internal separator along the axis.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: addWallButton
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable allows users to add a wall according to their selected specifications.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: externalWallPlacement
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable forces users to select only 0 or 1 for external wall placement, as fractions don’t make sense for external walls.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: deleteSelected
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable allows users to delete the component that is selected in the view.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: handleCheckMark
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable allows users to add a handle cutout on the selected wall.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: tabWidthControl
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This variable changes current tab width

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: mmInch
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This variable indicates which unit the user wants.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: mmInchDict
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This variable maps the mmInch boolean to their conversion factor. Inches don’t need to be changed converted, but millimeters need to be converted from inches.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This function is inherited from NSViewController. It changes any settings that you want when the view initially loads, or a box model is loaded into the session from a JSON.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This function is inherited from NSViewController.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: cameraLocked
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This variable indicates when the camera is locked onto a wall.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: moveSensitivity
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This variable gives wiggle room to the mouse event when clicking and dragging with right-click.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: rotateSensitivity
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This variable gives wiggle room to the mouse event when clicking and dragging with non-left and non-right clicks (like a side button).

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: zoomSensitivity
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This variable gives wiggle room to the mouse event when using the scroll bar.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: otherMouseDragged(with:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This function handles mouse movement when dragging the camera view around – it rotates the box model. See [Apple Documentation - otherMouseDragged()]. (https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nsresponder/1529804-othermousedragged?language=objc)

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: mouseMoved(with:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This function handles snap points and edge highlighting appearance when user is in “focused” view and hovering their cursor above the correct spot – camera locked on wall. See [Apple Documentation - mouseMoved()]. (https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nsresponder/1525114-mousemoved)

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: rightMouseDragged(with:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This function handles right click events with the mouse or trackpad (right-click and drag moves the box model around). See [Apple Documentation - rightMouseDragged()]. https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nsresponder/1529135-rightmousedragged)

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: mouseUp(with:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This function handles camera updates from clicks by either highlighting a wall (if one click on correct area), or focusing on a double-clicked wall for drawing. See [Apple Documentation - mouseUp()]. (https://developer.apple.com/documentation/swiftui/nshostingview/mouseup(with:))

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: keyUp(with:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This function handles key board input from user. See [Apple Documentation - keyUp()]. (https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nsgesturerecognizer/1526578-keyup)

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: scrollWheel(with:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This function handles mouse scrolling to zoom in and out of the view. See [Apple Documentation - scrollWheel()]. (https://developer.apple.com/documentation/swiftui/nshostingview/scrollwheel(with:))

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: magnify(with:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This function handles trackpad zoom. See [Apple Documentation - magnify()]. (https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nsresponder/1525862-magnify)

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: rotate(with:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This function handles trackpad view rotation. See [Apple Documentation - rotate()]. (https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nsresponder/1525572-rotate)

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: manageMouseDrag(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This function manages camera angles as the mouse drags the box around.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: changeLabels(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This function updates the label of any dimension in the view – inches or millimeters.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: mmMenuClicked(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This recieves input from the app’s menu that the user wants millimeters as their unit.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: inchMenuClicked(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This recieves input from the app’s menu that the user wants inches as their unit.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: lengthTextFieldDidChange(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This recieves input from the app’s dimensions panel that the user wants a different box length.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: unitSegmentedControl(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This recieves input from the app’s dimensions panel that the user wants a specific unit (inch or mm).

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: widthTextFieldDidChange(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This recieves input from the app’s dimensions panel that the user wants a different box width.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: heightTextFieldDidChange(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This recieves input from the app’s dimensions panel that the user wants a different box height.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: materialThicknessTextFieldDidChange(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This recieves input from the app’s dimensions panel that the user wants a different box material thickness.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: innerOrOuterDimensionsSelected(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This recieves input from the app’s dimensions panel that the user wants the dimensions to be either inner or outer (see BoxModel.innerDimension for description).

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: joinTypeSelected(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This recieves input from the app’s join panel that the user wants a different box join type.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: tabWidthChanged(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This recieves input from the app’s join panel that the user wants a different number of tabs.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: menuFileOpenItemSelected(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This recieves input from the app’s menu that the user wants to open a box model into the session from a selected JSON file.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: saveModel(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This recieves input from the app’s menu and the export button in the view that the user wants to save their box model.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: updateModel(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This update the InputViewController’s boxModel after changes were made.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: wallTypeOrPlaneChanged(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This recieves input from the app’s add components panel that the user updated the wall type or the wall plane. It is used to make sure the correct placement input is not hidden, and hides the correct one. It also disables the add wall button unless something other than the default “Type” is selected.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: findMissingExternalWalls(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This function finds the placements of the missing external walls in the box model, for user-friendly external wall adding.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: addWall(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This function takes in user input about the orientation, placement, and type of wall they want to add, and then sends those parameters off to BoxModel for the wall to be added to the template.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.name: updateSelectedWallPlane()
Classes/InputViewController.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This function is purely to make the Add Components more user friendly. All it does is update the label output in GUI to show the selected wall’s (highlighted wall’s) plane and placement, if one is selected. If adding walls is refactored, you probably won’t need this. The other idea is to add a coordinate system that adjusts according to the camera.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: deleteSelectedComponent(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This function simply tells the box model to delete the wall that is selected by the user. It also updates the intersectingWalls dictionary if one of the keys or values is the wall that is deleted.

Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.name: createHandle(_:)
Classes/InputViewController.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: This function creates a handle cutout on the selected component.

Classes/BoxViewController.html#/s:12Box_.name: sceneGenerator
Classes/BoxViewController.html#/s:12Box_.abstract: This variable is the singleton SceneGenerator. It ensures all classes are handling the same scene.

Classes/BoxViewController.html#/c:@M@Box.name: boxView
Classes/BoxViewController.html#/c:@M@Box.abstract: This variable is the view object that is displayed in the app.

Classes/BoxViewController.html#/c:@M@Box.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/BoxViewController.html#/c:@M@Box.abstract: This is an inherited function from NSViewController.

Classes/BoxViewController.html#/c:@M@Box.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/BoxViewController.html#/c:@M@Box.abstract: This is an inherited function from NSViewController.

Classes/BoxViewController.html#/s:12Box_.name: updateScene()
Classes/BoxViewController.html#/s:12Box_.abstract: This function ensures the SCNView(boxView).scene is updated with the generated scene from the code.

Classes/Shape.html#/s:12Box_Designer5Sha.name: xRadius
Classes/Shape.html#/s:12Box_Designer5Sha.abstract: This is the x-radius for the rounded radius for rounded rectangle shapes.

Classes/Shape.html#/s:12Box_Designer5Sha.name: yRadius
Classes/Shape.html#/s:12Box_Designer5Sha.abstract: This is the y-radius for the rounded radius for rounded rectangle shapes.

Classes/Shape.html#/s:12Box_Designer5Sha.name: areaRectangle
Classes/Shape.html#/s:12Box_Designer5Sha.abstract: This is the rectangle that describes the boundaries for the different cut out shapes.

Classes/Shape.html#/s:12Box_Designer5Sha.name: type
Classes/Shape.html#/s:12Box_Designer5Sha.abstract: This is the type of shape. It is necessary for decoding the cutout shapes from a JSON correctly – because WallModel has a [Shape] array, and this class is supposed to emulate an abstract class, the NSBezierPaths would not be able to draw without specifying the type of shape that was saved (see the draw() function below and the overridden draw() functions in Shape’s child classes.

Classes/Shape.html#/s:12Box_Designer5Sha.name: init(_:_:_:_:)
Classes/Shape.html#/s:12Box_Designer5Sha.abstract: This initializer instantiates a Codable-conforming Shape cutout.

Classes/Shape.html#/s:12Box_Designer5Sha.name: draw(_:)
Classes/Shape.html#/s:12Box_Designer5Sha.abstract: This is an abstract function. The children of the Shape class will draw their own NSBezierPaths onto the wall.

Classes/RoundedRectangle.html#/s:12Box_D.name: init(_:_:_:_:)
Classes/RoundedRectangle.html#/s:12Box_D.abstract: This initializer instantiates a Codable-conforming rounded rectangle cutout.

Classes/RoundedRectangle.html#/s:12Box_D.name: init(from:)
Classes/RoundedRectangle.html#/s:12Box_D.abstract: This is just the required initializer due to RoundedRectangle’s parent conforming to Codable.

Classes/RoundedRectangle.html#/s:12Box_D.name: draw(_:)
Classes/RoundedRectangle.html#/s:12Box_D.abstract: This function appends a rounded rectangle to the given NSBezierPath.

Classes/Rectangle.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: init(_:_:_:_:)
Classes/Rectangle.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This initializer instantiates a Codable-conforming rectangle cutout.

Classes/Rectangle.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: init(from:)
Classes/Rectangle.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This is just the required initializer due to Rectangle’s parent conforming to Codable.

Classes/Rectangle.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: draw(_:)
Classes/Rectangle.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This function appends a rectangle to the given NSBezierPath.

Classes/Circle.html#/s:12Box_Designer6Ci.name: init(_:_:_:_:)
Classes/Circle.html#/s:12Box_Designer6Ci.abstract: This initializer instantiates a Codable-conforming circle cutout.

Classes/Circle.html#/s:12Box_Designer6Ci.name: init(from:)
Classes/Circle.html#/s:12Box_Designer6Ci.abstract: This is just the required initializer due to Circle’s parent conforming to Codable.

Classes/Circle.html#/s:12Box_Designer6Ci.name: draw(_:)
Classes/Circle.html#/s:12Box_Designer6Ci.abstract: This function appends a circle to the given NSBezierPath.

Classes/SelectionHandling.html#/s:12Box_.name: shared
Classes/SelectionHandling.html#/s:12Box_.abstract: This variable enables SelectionHandling to be a singleton.

Classes/SelectionHandling.html#/s:12Box_.name: nodeColor
Classes/SelectionHandling.html#/s:12Box_.abstract: This variable is the SCNNode’s material color.

Classes/SelectionHandling.html#/s:12Box_.name: selectedNode
Classes/SelectionHandling.html#/s:12Box_.abstract: This variable is the associated node of the selected wall from the user.

Classes/SelectionHandling.html#/s:12Box_.name: hoverNode
Classes/SelectionHandling.html#/s:12Box_.abstract: This variable is the snap point when the user is in double-click focus mode. Right now, there are snap points at endpoints and midway points.

Classes/SelectionHandling.html#/s:12Box_.name: higlight()
Classes/SelectionHandling.html#/s:12Box_.abstract: This function highlights a whole selected node face.

Classes/SelectionHandling.html#/s:12Box_.name: highlightEdges(thickness:insideSelection:idvLines:)
Classes/SelectionHandling.html#/s:12Box_.abstract: This function is to thinly highlight the edge of a wall when it is in double-click focus mode.

Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: shared
Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: SceneGenerator is a singleton; it needs access points in various unrelated

Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: cameraOrbit
Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This variable provides the coordinate space for the box template.

Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: delegate
Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This variable is from the custom delegate that’s sole purpose is to properly update the scene if the user changes it. Note: not sure if this is neccesary, but FS2020 Fall ran out of time to refactor original code.

Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: camera
Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This variable indicates how the user is viewing their design.

Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: scene
Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This variable allows the specifications from cameraOrbit and camera to be displayed in the app window.

Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: init()
Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This class initializer instanstiates a nil delegate and a scene (which is the only scene, since this class is a Singleton).

Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: generateScene(_:)
Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This function renders the display in the view, ensuring that all components are drawn, the camera view is correct, and colors are as desired. This is where the 2-D walls are turned into 3-D SCNNodes via extrustion of the materialThickness.

Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: adjustLighting()
Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This function ensures the lighting in the scene is as desired; it deals with the background lighting, as well as the lighting on the box to make it more cube-like.

Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: adjustCamera(_:)
Classes/SceneGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This function will either set up a camera if it hasn’t been initialized, or it adjusts the scene according to the updated camera from the user.

Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.name: generatePath(_:_:_:_:_:numberTabs:handle:_:)
Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.abstract: This function uses the joinType and wallType parameters to select which function to use

Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.name: generateOverlapPath(_:_:_:_:)
Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.abstract: This function draws the necessary overlap join path for a specified wall type – the output path is a single wall component that can be drawn in the view. The basics of this function are that the top and bottom components (largeCorner) should overlap all four sides, while the longCorner walls should be overlapped by largeCorner and should overlap smallCorner, and the smallCorner walls should be overlapped by both largeCorner and longCorner.

Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.name: generateTabPath(_:_:_:_:numberTabs:)
Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.abstract: This function decides which function to use to draw the accurate tab join path for a specified wall type – the output path is a single wall component that can be drawn in the view.

Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.name: generateTabLargeLongCornerPath(_:_:_:_:_:)
Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.abstract: This function draws both largeCorner and longCorner tab paths; their path construction is similar enough to be condensed into one function with a few conditionals. The output of this function is a path that encompasses a single wall.

Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.name: generateTabSmallCornerPath(_:_:_:_:)
Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.abstract: This function draws smallCorner tab paths; its tab path construction is sufficiently different from largeCorner and longCorner that a separate function is necessary. This is essentially because it’s the smallest piece (it has to account for the tabs from both the largeCorner and longCorner walls). The output of this function is a path that encompasses a single wall.

Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.name: createOverlapPath(path:x12:x34:y14:y23:)
Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.abstract: This function alters an overlap-type path according to its inputs, which are dependent on wallType and decided in generateOverlapPath function. It does not return a path, simply alters the NSBezierPath that’s passed in.

Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.name: createTabPath(path:point1:point2:point3:point4:)
Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.abstract: This function alters a tab-type path according to its inputs. It does not return a path, simply alters the NSBezierPath that’s passed in. It creates one singular tab, with dimensions according to the distance between its points.

Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.name: generateSlotPath(_:_:_:_:)
Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.abstract: This function generates a slot join. It essentially interlocks adjacent sides by adding a half-slit that another wall can slide in to.

Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.name: generateShapePaths(_:_:)
Classes/PathGenerator.html#/s:12Box_Desi.abstract: This function iterates through the wall’s cut outs and appends them on to it’s path after being generated itself.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: view
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This variable is the view object that is displayed in the NSSavePanel instantiated in FileHandlingControl.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: fileHandlingControl
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This variable is the singleton file handling control.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: pdfWidthTextField
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This variable is the PDF width textbox that the user can change.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: pdfHeightTextField
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This variable is the PDF height textbox that the user can change.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: margin
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This variable is the PDF margin textbox that the user can change.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: padding
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This variable is the padding between drawn components on the PDF that the user can change.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: stroke
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This variable is the line thickness for the components drawn on the PDF, which the user can change.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: oneComponentButton
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This variable is the check box that indicates whether the user wants each component on a separate page, or the default layout (checked = one component on each page).

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: init(frame:)
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This is an inherited initializer. See Apple Documentation - NSView.init() for more information.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: init(coder:)
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This function allows the .xib file associated with this view (PDFOptionsView.xib) to be translated from interface builder to actual code.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: commonInit()
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This function is the main (custom) initializer for the view. It ensures the .xib file is what’s being shown in the this view.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This function provides the default values for the textboxes and checkbox. For more information on this inherited function, see Apple Documentation - awakeFromNib().

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: widthTextFieldChanged(_:)
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This function updates the singleton file handling control object with the PDF width value from this view.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: heightTextFieldChanged(_:)
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This function updates the singleton file handling control object with the PDF height value from this view.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: marginTextFieldChanged(_:)
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This function updates the singleton file handling control object with the PDF margin value from this view.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: paddingTextFieldChanged(_:)
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This function updates the singleton file handling control object with the PDF padding value from this view.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: oneComponentClicked(_:)
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This function updates the singleton file handling control object with the decision from the One Component checkbox in this view.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.name: strokeTextFieldChanged(_:)
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html#/c:@M@Box_De.abstract: This function updates the singleton file handling control object with the PDF stroke value from this view.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: wallNumber
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This variable indicates the key of a wall in the BoxModel.walls dictionary – it is intended to be the name of a wall.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: path
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This variable is essentially the wall in multi-vector form.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: wallShapes
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This variable is an array that includes all the cut out shapes on itself (the wall). While there isn’t functionality for deleting cutouts yet, this structure should make adding that functionality somewhat easy.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: materialThickness
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This variable is the material thickness, as indicated by the user. It is mainly necessary to correctly display the model in the app and to correctly draw the walls in a PDF.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: position
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This variable indicates where the path should start drawing; it is necessary so the model displays cohesively on the screen.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: width
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: For largeCorner and smallCorner wall types, this variable is associated with BoxModel.boxWidth. For longCorner wall type, this variable is associated with BoxModel.boxLength.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: length
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: For longCorner and smallCorner wall types, this variable is associated with BoxModel.boxHeight. For largeCorner wall type, this variable is associated with BoxModel.boxLength.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: wallType
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This variable indicates the type of wall (necessary for how the path is drawn). Internal walls should only be WallType.smallCorner (they should be overlapped by all other walls).

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: joinType
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This variable indicates the type of join (tab, overlap, or slotted). It accounts for the fact that internal walls should only be JoinType.overlap.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: numberTabs
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This variable indicates the number of tabs the user wants if the joinType == WallType.join. The type of wall changes how the tabs are drawn.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: innerWall
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This variable indicates if the wall is an internal separator, as these should never be JoinType.tab and should always be WallType.smallCorner.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: innerPlane
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This variable indicates the plane that the inner wall should be oriented on – the WallTypes are associated with planes (see WallType.swift).

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: handle
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This variable determines if the selected wall should have a handle or not on it

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: updatePath()
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This function sets the wall’s path from the return of PathGenerator’s generatePath function, using its self-updating variables.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: getWallNumber()
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This function returns the wall number of itself, as it’s a private variable.

This function makes WallModel conform to the Equatable protocol. For our purposes, a wall is “equal” to another if it’s in the same position. This function must be implemented for WallModel to be Hashable for a Dictionary (like BoxModel.walls and BoxModel.intersectinWalls.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: init(_:_:_:_:_:_:_:numberTabs:innerWall:innerPlane:handle:)
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This initializer creates a wall from its parameters. It also increments BoxModel.wallNumberStatic so that each new wall in the model is guaranteed to have a unique ID.

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: init(from:)
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This initializer is used to decode the Data from a user-selected JSON by using its CodingKeys. It is necessary for WallModel to conform to Codable (specifically, Decodable protocol).

Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.name: encode(to:)
Classes/WallModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer.abstract: This function enables BoxModel to conform to Codable (specifically, the Encodable protocol). It outputs Data, which is then converted to a string and saved at specific location (see FileHandlingControl.swift).

Classes/WallModel/CodingKeys.html.name: CodingKeys
Classes/WallModel/CodingKeys.html.abstract: This enum allows WallModel to be encoded and decoded without needing to encode/decode all its variables – specifically, the path variable does not need to be saved, as it would be a little harder to make an NSBezierPath conform to Codable, and it’s not necessary anyway. The path is simply generated when all the inputs to PathGenerator.generatePath() are decoded. The “cases” are the variables you want to be encoded/decoded.

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: sceneGenerator
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This variable ensures the current box model has access to the scene, so that it can update the scene after updating its attributes.

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: walls
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This variable is a dictionary of all the current walls that make up the box model. Its key is the wall number (a global variable), and its value is the associated wall. This data structure helps associate user-selected nodes in the application and their associated walls, as the nodes have the same name as the wall they are made from (see SceneGenerator.swift).

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: intersectingWalls
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This variable contains the pairs of intersecting walls in the box model (for internal separator dimension adjustments). The key is the wall that needs to adjust according to the walls in its value array. Put another way: the key is the intersecting wall, and its values are the walls it’s intersecting. Note: intersecting wall handling is done in chronological order of when the user adds internal walls.

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: boxWidth
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This variable refers to the box dimension along the x-axis. Adjusting it changes the width of walls on the Y-Z and X-Z plane and the position of walls on the X-Y plane.

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: boxLength
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This variable refers to the box dimension along the z-axis. Adjusting it changes the length of walls on the X-Z and Y-Z planes and the position of walls on the X-Y plane.

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: boxHeight
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This variable refers to the box dimension along the y-axis. Adjusting it changes the length of walls on the X-Y and Y-Z planes and the position of walls on the X-Z plane.

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: materialThickness
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: Update the dimensions of intersecting walls after changing box height. Scene is generated in this function to reflect changes.

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: innerDimensions
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This variable indicates whether the current width, height, and length of the box model should indicate 1) only the space between components (true) or 2) the space between components, along with the walls themselves (false).

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: joinType
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This variable indicates the join type between walls (tab, overlap, or slotted). Internal separators are always JoinType.overlap, which is dealt with in WallModel.swift, as well as the path generation for all walls when their JoinType changes..

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: numberTabs
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This variable indicates the number of tabs that the user wants, if the join type is “tab.” The minimum is 3, due to how PathGeneration.swift generates tab paths.

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: wallNumberStatic
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This global variable allows the walls and their nodes be associated without worrying about index changes after a wall is deleted from self.walls – the node is named the same as the wall when they are instantiated in SceneGenerator. This helps with organizing and deleting walls. It also associates the user’s selection with the WallModel class. It is a global variable so that walls can get a unique identifier each time one is instantiated.

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: init()
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This initializer creates the default box model which is loaded whenever the application is launched.

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: addWall(inner:type:placement:)
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This function adds a wall to the box model according to type (internal or external wall), plane (X-Y, Y-Z, X-Z; these are synonmous with WallType), and placement (how far from the origin do you want the wall to be placed? This is a fraction. Note: for external walls, it only make sense for them to be 0 or 1 so that they get placed on the outside).

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: updateIntersectingWalls()
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This function deals with the situation where an intersected wall is deleted from the box model, so the intersectingWalls dictionary needs to be updated.

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: adjustForIntersection(_:_:)
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This function adjusts two intersecting walls depending on 1) which one is being intersected and 2) which planes they are no (in order to correct the right dimension for the intersecting wall’s plane).

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: adjustAllIntersections()
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This function simply iterates through the intersectingWalls dictionary and adjusts dimensions accordingly – mainly used for when the box’s attributes change from user input.

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: init(from:)
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This initializer is used to decode the Data from a user-selected JSON by using its CodingKeys. It is necessary for BoxModel to conform to Codable (specifically, Decodable protocol).

Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.name: encode(to:)
Classes/BoxModel.html#/s:12Box_Designer0.abstract: This function enables BoxModel to conform to Codable (specifically, the Encodable protocol). It outputs Data, which is then converted to a string and saved at specific location (see FileHandlingControl.swift).

Classes/BoxModel/CodingKeys.html.name: CodingKeys
Classes/BoxModel/CodingKeys.html.abstract: This enum allows BoxModel to be encoded and decoded without needing to encode/decode all its variables – specifically, the sceneGenerator variable does not need to be saved, as it would be a little harder to make SceneGenerator conform to Codable, and it’s not necessary anyway. The “cases” are simply the variables you want to be encoded/decoded.

Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.name: shared
Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This allows the FileHandlingControl to be a Singleton.

Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.name: oneComponent
Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This variable tells the PDF to print each component on its own page or not.

Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.name: pdfHeight
Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This is the default PDF document height (in inches) for the option menu when saving.

Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.name: pdfWidth
Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This is the default PDF document width (in inches) for the option menu when saving.

Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.name: margin
Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This is the default PDF document margin (in inches) for the option menu when saving. It’s the minimum distance between the side of the PDF document and the closest drawn component.

Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.name: padding
Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This is the default PDF document padding (in inches) for the option menu when saving. It’s the minimum distance between the components being drawn.

Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.name: stroke
Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This is the default PDF document stroke for the option menu when saving. It is the line thickness.

Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.name: saveModel(_:_:)
Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This is the function that instantiates a save panel in the desired window so that the user can save to their desired directory.

Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.name: openModel()
Classes/FileHandlingControl.html#/s:12Bo.abstract: This is the function that opens a previously-saved box model (JSON format) into the application. It utilizes the JSONDecoder().

Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: document
Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This variable instantiates a PDF document to be drawn on.

Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: boxModel
Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This variable will be the box model that needs to be drawn.

Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: pages
Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This variable is an array of custom PDF pages that will be added to the document.

Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: nsContext
Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This variable is also the higher-level drawing environment.

Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: mediaBox
Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This variable is the size of the PDF.

Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: fileHandlingControl
Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This variable is the singleton file handling control object.

Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: inchScale
Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This variable essentially converts inches to pixels.

Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: init(targetURL:_:)
Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: The initalizer for this class ensures that all variables need to draw to a PDFPage are instantiated.

Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: addPage(_:)
Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This function adds a custom PDF page to the PDF document. It uses the CG and NS Graphics Contexts to draw on the page.

Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: oneComponentPerPageLayout()
Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This function ensures only one wall is drawn on a single PDF page. Therefore, the number of PDF pages = the number of walls in the box model.

Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: defaultPDFDisplay()
Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This function creates a PDF document with a default layout; the default layout is simply putting however many walls can fit onto a PDF page, and adding more pages as needed.

Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.name: saveAsPDF()
Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html#/s:12Box_Des.abstract: This function is the main driver for saving the desired PDF. It decides which layout to initiate and then saves the finished PDF document to the user’s chosen location.

Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.name: fileHandlingControl
Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.abstract: This variable is the singleton file handling control object.

Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.name: wallsToDraw
Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.abstract: This variable is the array of walls that need to be drawn on the PDF page.

Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.name: inchScale
Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.abstract: This variable is the conversion from inches to pixels.

Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.name: firstLineDrawn
Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.abstract: This variable indicates whether the first line of the wall being drawn has been drawn (drawn is true, not drawn is false).

Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.name: init(_:)
Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.abstract: This initializer sets up the walls that need to be drawn on the PDF page.

Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.name: drawPaths(for:)
Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.abstract: This function draws wall starting at the bottom left of the PDF page and going up, it then moves to the right and starts drawing up from the bottom again.

Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.name: drawLine(fromPoint:toPoint:controlPoint1:controlPoint2:)
Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html#/s:12Box_D.abstract: This function does the actual drawing on the PDF page using the NSBezierPath.stroke() function.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Box_Desig.name: window
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Box_Desig.abstract: This is the viewing window for the application.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Box_Desig.name: boxViewController
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Box_Desig.abstract: This is the View Controller for the macOS menu bar.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Box_Desig.name: inputViewController
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@Box_Desig.abstract: This is the View Controller for the main app interface.

Classes/AppDelegate.html.name: AppDelegate
Classes/AppDelegate.html.abstract: AppDelegate for BoxDesigner application – initializes application views.

Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html.name: BoxDesignPDFPage
Classes/BoxDesignPDFPage.html.abstract: This class is the main driver for creating and drawing a single PDF page of the box model walls.

Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html.name: BoxDesignerPDF
Classes/BoxDesignerPDF.html.abstract: This class is the main driver for creating and drawing a completed PDF document of the current box model.

Classes/FileHandlingControl.html.name: FileHandlingControl
Classes/FileHandlingControl.html.abstract: This is the controlling class for exporting the custom box template to PDF or JSON, or opening a saved box template into the application via JSON file (JSON capabilities are implemented via native Swift Encoding/Decoding functionality).

Classes/BoxModel.html.name: BoxModel
Classes/BoxModel.html.abstract: This class provides the structure for the complete box model. It can encode and decode itself in order to a save a box template and reopen it in the app, and it deals with all intersecting wall issues (as well as general maintenance when user changes features in the app).

Classes/WallModel.html.name: WallModel
Classes/WallModel.html.abstract: This class provides the structure for a single wall in the box model.

Classes/PDFOptionsView.html.name: PDFOptionsView
Classes/PDFOptionsView.html.abstract: This class is the accessory view that’s included in the save panel when exporting the box template to PDF or JSON.

Classes/PathGenerator.html.name: PathGenerator
Classes/PathGenerator.html.abstract: This class is the driver behind rendering the user’s desired box correctly on the screen. It handles the tab and overlap join types and ensures the paths are drawn correctly.

Classes/SceneGenerator.html.name: SceneGenerator
Classes/SceneGenerator.html.abstract: This class handles the continual scene generation that is viewed in the application.

Classes/SelectionHandling.html.name: SelectionHandling
Classes/SelectionHandling.html.abstract: This class handles the selection and highlighting of components that the user wants to interact with, as well as snap point and edge highlighting when user is in “focus” mode.

Classes/Circle.html.name: Circle
Classes/Circle.html.abstract: This class provides the structure and path-appending for the circle cutouts.

Classes/Rectangle.html.name: Rectangle
Classes/Rectangle.html.abstract: This class provides the structure and path-appending for rectangle cutouts.

Classes/RoundedRectangle.html.name: RoundedRectangle
Classes/RoundedRectangle.html.abstract: This class provides the structure and path-appending for the rounded rectangle cutouts.

Classes/Shape.html.name: Shape
Classes/Shape.html.abstract: This class provides an abstract-like class for the allowed cutout shapes. This set up enables the types of cutout shapes to be easily extended in the future. Note: although it’s usually better to use protocols as a substitute for abstract classes in Swift, protocols cannot conform to Codable. Therefore, this class was used.

Classes/BoxViewController.html.name: BoxViewController
Classes/BoxViewController.html.abstract: This class handles updating the scene within the application.

Classes/InputViewController.html.name: InputViewController
Classes/InputViewController.html.abstract: This class handles all user interactions with the application.
